dtd.name: COVID_AE_AMIA
dtd.text:
<!ENTITY name "COVID_AE_AMIA">

<!-- Entity Tag -->
<!ELEMENT Fever      ( #PCDATA ) >
<!ATTLIST Fever certainty ( Positive | Negated | Hypothetic | Possible ) #IMPLIED "Positive" >

<!-- Entity Tag -->
<!ELEMENT Pain       ( #PCDATA ) >
<!ATTLIST Pain  certainty ( Positive | Negated | Hypothetic | Possible ) #IMPLIED "Positive" >

<!-- Entity Tag -->
<!ELEMENT Severity   ( #PCDATA ) >
<!ATTLIST Severity  type ( Not bothersome | Mild | Moderate | Severe | NA ) #IMPLIED "NA" >

<!-- Relation Tag -->
<!ELEMENT AE_lk      EMPTY >
<!ATTLIST AE_lk arg0 IDREF prefix="Pain" #IMPLIED>
<!ATTLIST AE_lk arg1 IDREF prefix="Pain_Severity" #IMPLIED>

anns.text: Received shot in left arm. About one hour after receiving the shot, I started getting very severe pain in my upper right arm that slowly spread to the right side of my neck. My right ear began to feel slightly funny, but no pain. Was going to the hospital but the all the pain went away after about 15 to 20 minutes. No problems after that so I didn't go to the hospital. I did not take any medication.

_sentences.text: Received shot in left arm.
About one hour after receiving the shot, I started getting very severe pain in my upper right arm that slowly spread to the right side of my neck.
My right ear began to feel slightly funny, but no pain.
Was going to the hospital but the all the pain went away after about 15 to 20 minutes.
No problems after that so I didn't go to the hospital.
I did not take any medication.

anns._sentences_text:
Received shot in left arm.
 About one hour after receiving the shot, I started getting very severe pain in my upper right arm that slowly spread to the right side of my neck.
 My right ear began to feel slightly funny, but no pain.
 Was going to the hospital but the all the pain went away after about 15 to 20 minutes.
 No problems after that so I didn't go to the hospital.
 I did not take any medication.

anns.text: I woke up at 1:30 and my entire body was aching, but like each spot had its own ache -- not a general overall ache.  Very hard to describe.  I don't mean a little ache here or there.  I mean I couldn't turn on either side or flip over.  Even the backs of my hands separately ached.  I'd never felt like this before.    After 15 minutes of trying to figure out what was going on, I got up and took 2 Advils.  About 20 minutes later, the aching had subsided.

_sentences.text: I woke up at 1:30 and my entire body was aching, but like each spot had its own ache -- not a general overall ache.
Very hard to describe.
I don't mean a little ache here or there.
I mean I couldn't turn on either side or flip over.
Even the backs of my hands separately ached.
I'd never felt like this before.
After 15 minutes of trying to figure out what was going on, I got up and took 2 Advils.
About 20 minutes later, the aching had subsided.

anns._sentences_text:
I woke up at 1:30 and my entire body was aching, but like each spot had its own ache -- not a general overall ache.
  Very hard to describe.
  I don't mean a little ache here or there.
  I mean I couldn't turn on either side or flip over.
  Even the backs of my hands separately ached.
  I'd never felt like this before.
    After 15 minutes of trying to figure out what was going on, I got up and took 2 Advils.
  About 20 minutes later, the aching had subsided.

anns.text: Body aches, fever 101.1. No treatment. outcome mild improvement repeat temp 100.4

No treatment.
outcome mild improvement repeat temp 100.4

 No treatment.
 outcome mild improvement repeat temp 100.4

anns.text: Severe body aches 24 hours after the vaccine was administered.  These aches lasted throughout the day.  I took three doses of 800mg Ibuprofen and tow doses of 1000mg Tylenol to get through the day.  They were gone by the next morning (48 hours after administration) and no additional pain medicine was needed.

_sentences.text: Severe body aches 24 hours after the vaccine was administered.
These aches lasted throughout the day.
I took three doses of 800mg Ibuprofen and tow doses of 1000mg Tylenol to get through the day.
They were gone by the next morning (48 hours after administration) and no additional pain medicine was needed.

anns._sentences_text:
Severe body aches 24 hours after the vaccine was administered.
  These aches lasted throughout the day.
  I took three doses of 800mg Ibuprofen and tow doses of 1000mg Tylenol to get through the day.
  They were gone by the next morning (48 hours after administration) and no additional pain medicine was needed.

anns.text: Sciatica nerve pain throbbing constantly from left butt down left leg to my calf.  Started February 16th, strong pain (just bearable).  Starting February 20th, pain slightly subsided and just painful during walking.  Starting February 22nd (today), slightly less painful. I am hoping this is not permanent...

_sentences.text: Sciatica nerve pain throbbing constantly from left butt down left leg to my calf.
Started February 16th, strong pain (just bearable).
Starting February 20th, pain slightly subsided and just painful during walking.
Starting February 22nd (today), slightly less painful.
I am hoping this is not permanent...

  Started February 16th, strong pain (just bearable).
  Starting February 20th, pain slightly subsided and just painful during walking.
  Starting February 22nd (today), slightly less painful.
 I am hoping this is not permanent...

anns.text: Last Friday low grade 100.5 fever about 10 hours after vaccination. Fever went away over night. Broke out in hives all over body about 24 hours after vaccination. Have taken Benadryl twice, hives are going away. Woke up on Monday night with muscle pain in left shoulder, neck. Continues through Tuesday off and on.

_sentences.text: Last Friday low grade 100.5 fever about 10 hours after vaccination.
Fever went away over night.
Broke out in hives all over body about 24 hours after vaccination.
Have taken Benadryl twice, hives are going away.
Woke up on Monday night with muscle pain in left shoulder, neck.
Continues through Tuesday off and on.

anns.text: Temperature of 99 by 11:00 PM on 1/8, had a fever of 101.1 by 5:00 AM on 1/9, fever of 100 continued until 8:00 PM on 1/9

anns.text: Fever onset approx 4 hours and have had high grade and low grade fevers since.  Taking tylenol every 4-6 hours.

_sentences.text: Fever onset approx 4 hours and have had high grade and low grade fevers since.
Taking tylenol every 4-6 hours.

anns._sentences_text:

  Taking tylenol every 4-6 hours.

anns.text: High high high fever. exceeded 105 while i was sleeping. I've been taking advil and Tylenol to try to get it under control. I'm also eating ice cream and using an ice pack.

exceeded 105 while i was sleeping.

I'm also eating ice cream and using an ice pack.

anns.text: I developed a fever of 102 the evening after getting the vaccine. I went to bed with fluids and advil and woke with not further issues.

sentence_splitting_algorithm.title: Sentence Splitting Algorithm
sentence_splitting_algorithm.html:
MedTator can display text content in different ways, which include a sentence-mode display. To display the split sentences correctly, the original content must be tokenized in sentence level. There are several different methods / algorithms for sentence tokenization, and these methods are implemented in different packages / libraries. MedTator provides some options for selecting different methods.
  • The default method is a simple splitting algorithm based on symbol detection. This algorithm will check each character in the given text and compare it with pre-defined schema. The result of this algorithm works for most of cases, and has great performance.
  • The Compromise NLP method is implemented based on Compromise NLP library. It provides APIs for sentence spliting and formating. For more information, its provides more technical details.
  • The Wink NLP method is based on WinkJS NLP library.
